review: I just received my Apple TV box and I love it.  I already have an iMac and an iPad, so everything is compatible.  I use it to put anything I find on my iPad up on the big screen.  Last week, I put up a college wrestling meet from the PAC 12 network. The picture was perfect as was the sound.  I found that anything I want to share with someone else in the room is easily readable when put up on the TV.  I can also send my music collection easily out through the TV sound system.  So far, this product everything I hoped it would be and more.

author: John Simonds

review: Apple means different things to different people.  I personally love apple products, but I don't live completely in the Apple ecosphere, meaning I have a windows laptop and use google for a lot.The major plus of this devise is Airplay!  I have a iPad, and iPhone, and I would say 85% of the time it works perfectly.  There are occasional hiccups getting it on the TV, content will randomly decide not to work on Airplay.  Overall I love this dongle technology stuff!I primarily use it to stream content from a NAS drive I have hooked up to my home network.  Of course the NAS drive has an iOS app which lets me Airplay it to my TV via the Apple TV.  Fantastic!The downside is that it's not an end all solution for television.  I dropped TV service completely so I've tried every other alternative, including watching TV shows through websites.  Netflix and other apps are supported here, but they don't have everything, so beyond that its out of my hands whether or not a website will let me Airplay to the Apple TV.  iPad mirroring is cool, but the aspect ratio is different so streaming full screen video isn't full screen on your TV (I don't like that).However if you're looking for TV solutions consider this: the average TV service is about $50 per month.  On Apple TV you can buy a full season of a TV show for about $30.  So in a year's time, you could own a full season of 20 different shows for the same $600 you would have spent on cable or dish.  I say that plus an antenna is good enough for me.  Of course you have to have good internet to make this work, so factor that in.
